title: Russia rejects travel ban on its citizensTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Russia rejects travel ban on its citizens Published on : Sunday, August 30, 2015
A statement released by the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs stated, “We have no plans to direct Russians towards domestic tourism through bans or restrictions. We will attain that goal by developing the domestic tourism industry, improving citizens’ economic prospects and offering safe travel and quality service.”
Yevgeniy Marchenko, a member of the St. Petersburg city legislature, had requested that travel to countries such as Turkey, Egypt and Thailand be restricted due to various threats faced by tourists. The main dangers listed in Marchenko’s letter included traffic accidents, careless hotel staff, local criminals, alcohol and food poisoning.
Two Russian nationals died in a traffic accident in Thailand in July, a bus accident in Egypt killed two tourists in May, and two more Russian tourists died in a car wreck in Turkey in August.
Marchenko suggested if an outright ban was not possible, Russia could introduce a new visa regime with these countries, reduce the number of charter flights, force insurance companies to raise prices and start an educational campaign warning citizens of the hazards.
